name: St. Andrew Kim Taegon

locations.description: First Korean priest, martyred in Korea

summary: Andrew Kim Taegon was the first Korean-born Catholic priest and is one of the Korean Martyrs. He was born into a Christian family during a time of severe persecution in Korea. He traveled to Macau to study for the priesthood and was ordained in Shanghai. Upon returning to Korea, he was arrested and martyred at the age of 25. He is the patron saint of Korea and Korean Catholics. He was canonized along with 102 other Korean martyrs in 1984.
